  • main

main¶

author: Arne Hoelter, Audio Communication Group, TU Berlin

The main script of the pyPALC application. This is a Loudspeaker Array Optimization Software to find the tilt angles of the Loudspeaker Cabinets. The application works with a bokeh server that can be called by typing “bokeh serve –show pyPALC” in the terminal on the directory that contains the “pyPALC” folder.

The script is structured as follows:

  1. Import all necessary modules

  2. Definition objects for calculation and ColumnDataSources for visualization

  3. Definition of callbacks

  4. Definition of usable widgets

  5. Connection of widgets with callbacks

  6. Setting up all figures, tables and tabs

  7. Defining the start page (venue creation)

main.Bar_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1012', ...)¶

Contains the values of the bar plot of the PALC results.

main.Bar_dict_ref = ColumnDataSource(id='1013', ...)¶

Contains the values of the bar plot of the reference results.

main.Beamplot_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1018', ...)¶

Contains the SPL, start points, height and widtch of the beamplot (PALC and reference).

main.Homogeneity_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1011', ...)¶

Contains the computed homogeneity.

main.Opt_SPLoverX_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1016', ...)¶

Contains SPL and distance values on the hinges of the target slope.

main.Opt_arr = <PALC_classes.Array_opt object>¶

Data of the optimized array

main.Opt_w = <PALC_classes.Opt_weight object>¶

Data needed for the target slope optimization of PALC (SPL over distance)

main.PALC_config = <PALC_classes.PALC_configuration object>¶

PALC configuration

main.PALC_pal = <PALC_classes.PALC_compatible_PAL object>¶

PALC compatible venue slice (with audience lines)

main.PALC_plots = <PALC_classes.PALC_plotting object>¶

Plot data of PALC results

main.PALC_plots_ref = <PALC_classes.PALC_plotting object>¶

Plot data of the reference array

main.Ref_arr = <PALC_classes.Array_opt object>¶

Data of the reference array

main.SFP_config = <PALC_classes.SFP_configuration object>¶

Sound Field Prediction configuration (CDPS-Model)

main.SFP_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1009', ...)¶

Contains the sound pressure levels of PALC and reference computed by the CDPS model.

main.SFPv_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1010', ...)¶

Contains the discrete venue slice points needed for visualization of SFP_dict.

main.SPLoverX = <PALC_classes.Opt_weight object>¶

Result data of SPL over distance computation

main.SPLoverX_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1015', ...)¶

Contains the SPL values over distance between LSA reference point and the receiver positions normalized on 0 dB (if target slope, optimization region is used.

main.SPLoverX_optreg = ColumnDataSource(id='1017', ...)¶

Contains edges of the drawn polygon which indicates the optimization region

main.Tech_res = <PALC_classes.Technical_meas_results object>¶

Results of the technical measures of the PALC optimized array

main.Tech_res_ref = <PALC_classes.Technical_meas_results object>¶

Results of the technical measures of the reference array

Decreases gui_weighting_nu by weighting_step_size.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.adjust_weighting_plus()[source]¶

Increases gui_weighting_nu by weighting_step_size.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.audience_line_tap(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Controls the visibility of line saving and removing buttons / widgets depending on user selection of audience lines. Updates audience_line_tap_dict if a line is selected (or not). Triggered if user taps on a line in figure p.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Attribute name (here index).

  • old (int) – Index of previously tapped line. [] if no line is tapped.

  • new (int) – Index of actually tapped line. [] if no line is tapped..

Returns

Return type

None.

main.audience_line_tap_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1020', ...)¶

Contains the tapped line of the venue slice plot.

main.button_input = FileInput(id='1060', ...)¶

FileInput widget to upload measured (complex) directivity data. Triggers upload_directivity.

main.change_start_pal_button(has_pal)[source]¶

If check_PAL terminated succesfully, the “Run Calcution” Button is enabled.

Parameters

has_pal (bool) – If True: PALC computation is enabled, otherwise disabled.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.check_PAL()[source]¶

Creates a PALC compatible venue slice suggestions based on the lines drawn by the user. Updates guinalplt and guisfpplt. Calls checkPAL functions and PALC_pal methods to create the venue. PALC_pal may then be used for PALC computation. Resets initialization of Opt_w. Triggered by check_PAL_button.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.check_PAL_button = Button(id='1056', ...)¶

Button widget to check the created venue slice. Triggers check_PAL

main.chg_weight_links(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Sets the number of hinges for the target slope weighting optimization. Calls get_weight_links. Triggered by gui_opt_weight_link.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value).

  • old (float) – Old number of hinges in target slope.

  • new (float) – New number of hinges in target slope.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.choose_dangles(attr, old, new)[source]¶

If discrete angles are used, text input field to insert a set of discrete tilt angles is enabled (and filled with a default set). Triggered by gui_use_dangles.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value can be ‘Yes’ or ‘No’).

  • old (str) – Old value of the widget gui_use_dangles.

  • new (TYPE) – New value of the widget gui_use_dangles.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.clear_result_fig()[source]¶

Clears the venue slice plot. Calls venue_slice2CDS. Triggered by gui_clear_result_fig and in some cases by steps.

main.create_prev_line()[source]¶

Creates a line in front of the selected line (only possible if a line is selected). Gets the tapped line from audience_line_tap_dict, checks the draw conditions and inserts the line with … Stores the data in guilineplt. Triggered by save_prev_line_button.

Returns

Return type

None.

Audience lines drawn by user

Contains the directivity of 100 Hz, 1 kHz and 10 kHz used in SFP (CDPS-model). Plotted on the second page.

main.end_point_y = TextInput(id='1050', ...)¶

Contains the tilt angles of the reference LSA.

main.get_beamplot(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Calculates the beamplot of PALC results and / or reference array and saves the beamplot data in a dictionary for visualization. Triggered by gui_f_beam or gui_which_beam. Calls set_beamplot_visibility and getBeamplotRes.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (Either value or active).

  • old (either float or int) – Old attribute.

  • new (either float or int) – New attribute.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.get_discrete_angles(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Reads a set of discrete tilt angles. Enabled if gui_use_dangles is set to ‘Yes’. Triggered by gui_discrete_angles.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute.

  • old (str) – Old set of discrete tilt angles.

  • new (str) – New set of discrete tilt angles with ‘,’ as seperator and ‘.’ as decimal seperator.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.get_ref_array_angles(chg_n=False)[source]¶

Saves and calculates the reference array tilt angles. Is triggered by reference_array_setting, gui_ref_start, gui_ref_step_stop, gui_ref_discrete_angles and gui_ref_userdef.

Parameters

chg_n (bool, optional) – True if number of LSA cabinets has changed. The default is False.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.get_value(attr, old, new)[source]¶

This function saves the user input of many widgets into the config objects PALC_config and SFP_config by calling store_config. The widgets that trigger this function are:

  • gui_x_H - Highest front point of the LSA on the x-axis

  • gui_y_H - Highest front point of the LSA on the y-axis

  • gui_Lambda_y - Height of the loudspeakers

  • gui_Lambda_gap - Distance between adjacent LSA cabinets

  • gui_PALC_alg - Algorithm type (PALC1, PALC2 or PALC3)

  • gui_N_LS - Number of LSA cabinets

  • gui_psi_n - Initialization aperture angle of LSA cabinets

  • gui_use_dangles - Selection it continuous or discrete tilt angles shall be used (does not trigger this function directly)

  • gui_gap_handling - Gap handling approach (Without, Soft or Hard Margin)

  • gui_strength_smarg - Strength of the soft margin gap handling approach

  • gui_directivity - Loudspeaker directivity (Circular Piston, Line Piston, Combined Circular and Line Piston or Measured Loudspeaker Data)

  • gui_fixed_first_angle - If the highest LSA cabinet shall be mounted with a fixed tilt angle, this widget takes the fixed angle in degree.

If entered value cannot be stored, the default values will be used. Calls also get_ref_array_angles if the value of gui_use_dangles or gui_N_LS has changed. Always calls round_fixed_angle, choose_gap_handling, update_gh_w_select and init_dir_plot. Updates ranges of figures.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value).

  • old (either str, int, float) – Old value of changed attribute of triggered widget.

  • new (either str, int, float) – New value of changed attribute of triggered widget.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.gui_Lambda_gap = TextInput(id='1064', ...)¶

TextInput to define gaps between the LS cabinets. Triggers get_value

main.gui_Lambda_y = TextInput(id='1058', ...)¶

TextInput widget to define the height of the used LSA cabinets. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_N_LS = TextInput(id='1061', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the number of LS cabinets in LSA. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_PALC_alg = Select(id='1072', ...)¶

Select widget to choose the type of the algorithm. Either PALC1 (Splay angles are equal), PALC2 (Splay angles depend on distance to receiver), PALC3 Similar to PALC2, tan of splay angles is used). Triggers get_value.

main.gui_clear_result_fig = Button(id='1088', ...)¶

Button widget to clear the plotted venue slice with LSA and rays. Triggers clear_result_fig

main.gui_directivity = Select(id='1059', ...)¶

Select widget to choose a directivity of the LSA cabinets used in the Sound Field Prediction. Can be either Circular Piston, Line Piston, Comined Circular and Line Piston (x-over at 1.5 kHz) or Measured Loudspeaker Data. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_discrete_angles = TextInput(id='1066', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the discrete tilt angles. Triggers get_discrete_angles.

main.gui_download_result = Button(id='1089', ...)¶

Button widget to download the PALC tilt angles in .csv format

main.gui_f_beam = Select(id='1090', ...)¶

Select widget to choose the plotted frequency in the beamplot. Triggers get_beamplot.

main.gui_fixed_first_angle = TextInput(id='1085', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the fixed angle of the heighest LSA cabinet. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_gap_handling = Select(id='1073', ...)¶

Select widget to choose the gap handling approach. Either Without (No gap handling), Hard Margin (based on assumed splay angles, gaps are totally avoided), Soft Margin (gaps are lower weighted). Triggers get_value.

main.gui_opt_weight_link = Select(id='1076', ...)¶

Select widget to choose number of hinges in target slope when ‘Target Slope’ is chosen in gui_weighting. The number of choosable hinges depends on the number of audience lines.

main.gui_psi_n = TextInput(id='1057', ...)¶

TextInput widget to define the initial splay / aperture angle of the LSA cabinets. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_ref_array = Select(id='1067', ...)¶

Select widget to choose the type of the reference LSA. Triggers reference_array_setting

main.gui_ref_discrete_angles = Select(id='1068', ...)¶

Select widget to choose if discrete tilt angles of gui_discrete_angles shall be used. Triggers get_ref_array_angles.

main.gui_ref_start = TextInput(id='1069', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the angle of the heighest LSA cabinet in reference array. Triggers get_ref_array_angles.

main.gui_ref_step_stop = TextInput(id='1070', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the inter cabinet angle of the reference array. Triggers get_ref_array_angles.

main.gui_ref_userdef = TextAreaInput(id='1071', ...)¶

TextAreaInput widget to enter user defined tilt angles of the reference array. Triggers get_ref_array_angles.

main.gui_start = Toggle(id='1087', ...)¶

Toggle widget to start the PALC and SFP computation.

main.gui_step = RadioButtonGroup(id='1169', ...)¶

RadioButtonGroup widget to switch between the different pages.

main.gui_strength_smarg = Slider(id='1074', ...)¶

Slider widget to set the strength of soft margin approach, if chosen in gui_gap_handling. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_tolerance = Slider(id='1083', ...)¶

Slider widget to set the tolerance, which is the break out condition of the PALC computation. It is the distance of covered region to the first audience position in m. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_use_dangles = Select(id='1065', ...)¶

Select widget to choose if discrete tilt angles shall be used. Triggers choose_dangles.

main.gui_use_fixed_angles = Select(id='1084', ...)¶

Select widget to choose if the heighest LSA cabinet shall be fixed on a specific angle.

main.gui_weighting = Select(id='1075', ...)¶

Select widget to choose the weighting approach. Triggers weighting_select.

main.gui_weighting_nu = Slider(id='1078', ...)¶

Slider widget to set the strength of the weighting if ‘Linear Spacing’ or ‘Logarithmic Spacing’ is chosen in gui_weighting. Triggers store_weighting_nu.

main.gui_which_beam = CheckboxGroup(id='1091', ...)¶

CheckboxGroup widget to choose wheter PALC and/or Reference results shall be shown as a beamplot. Triggers get_beamplot.

main.gui_x_H = TextInput(id='1062', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the mounting point in x-direction (front position of the heighest LS cabinet. Triggers get_value.

main.gui_y_H = TextInput(id='1063', ...)¶

TextInput widget to enter the mounting height of the LSA (top front of the highest LS cabinet. Triggers get_value

main.guilineplt = ColumnDataSource(id='1002', ...)¶

Contains the drawn audience lines based on user input. After compatibilization to the PALC algorithm, shows the lines used for PALC and SFP.

main.guinalplt = ColumnDataSource(id='1003', ...)¶

Contains non audience lines, e.g., gaps between audience line.

main.guipal = ColumnDataSource(id='1001', ...)¶

Contains data points that are given by user. Visualized in venue slice plot.

main.guisfpplt = ColumnDataSource(id='1004', ...)¶

Contains audience lines that are not used for PALC calcution but for SFP.

main.line_discretization = TextInput(id='1051', ...)¶

TextInput widget to define the discretization in points per m of audience lines

main.optimal_SPLoverX(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Triggered if user draws in pSPLoverX. Sets is2update attribute of :any:Opt_w` to zero. Opt_SPLoverX_dict is automatically updated.

main.p = Figure(id='1183', ...)¶

Venue Slice Plot

main.pBar = Figure(id='1809', ...)¶

Barplot of PALC results. Number of Positions that contain SPL values on y-axis.

main.pBarref = Figure(id='1848', ...)¶

Barplot of reference array. Number of Positions that contain SPL values on y-axis.

main.pBeam = Figure(id='1701', ...)¶

Beamplot of PALC results

main.pBeam_ref = Figure(id='1755', ...)¶

Beamplot of reference array

main.pHom = Figure(id='1628', ...)¶

Frequency Response Plot of reference array of each discrete point on venue slice. Color of the responses belongs to the discrete points in figure pSFPv.

main.pSFP = Figure(id='1552', ...)¶

Frequency Response Plot of PALC results of each discrete point on venue slice. Color of the responses belongs to the discrete points in figure pSFPv.

main.pSFPv = Figure(id='1510', ...)¶

Venue Slice Plot of SFP, shows the discrete points of the venue slice in color of the frequency responses in pSFP.

main.pSPLoverX = Figure(id='1406', ...)¶

Sound Pressure over Distance Plot. If Target Slope weighting is chosen, the target slope can be adjusted within this figure.

main.p_equal_axis = RadioGroup(id='1170', ...)¶

RadioGroup widget to set the scaling of the venue slice plot. Triggers scale_p_axis.

main.pdir = Figure(id='1328', ...)¶

Directivity Plot of 100 Hz, 1 kHz and 10 kHz to check used directivity in SFP and / or uploaded measured loudspeaker data.

main.plot_patches = ColumnDataSource(id='1019', ...)¶

Contains the values to plot the LSA cabinets with bokeh’s patch function.

main.plt_ranges = <PALC_classes.Plot_ranges object>¶

Ranges of the plots

main.plt_venue_slice_1 = ColumnDataSource(id='1006', ...)¶

Contains data to plot the LSA cabinets in venue slice plot.

main.plt_venue_slice_2 = ColumnDataSource(id='1005', ...)¶

Contains the rays from LSA cabinets to the venue slice in venue slice plot.

Saves the current setting of the reference LSA. Set widgets visible / invisible or enables / disables them if needed / not needed. Triggered by gui_ref_array.

Parameters

  • new (str) – New reference array setting.

Returns

Return type

None.

Removes the last created line. Triggered by remove_line_button.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.remove_line_button = Button(id='1053', ...)¶

Button widget to remove audience lines. Triggers remove_line

main.remove_sel_line()[source]¶

Removes the selected line. Tapped line is stored in audience_line_tap_dict. The index of the lines behind the removed line are then shifted by -1. Triggered by remove_sel_line_button.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.remove_sel_line_button = Button(id='1055', ...)¶

Button widget to remove a audience line in front of the selected line. Triggers remove_sel_line

main.results_dict = ColumnDataSource(id='1007', ...)¶

Contains the tilt angles of the LSA cabinet computed by PALC.

main.save_line()[source]¶

Function to draw audience lines based on the data stored in guipal. Triggered by save_line_button Checks the defined conditions defined in checkPAL. These are:

  1. Stop values are bigger or equal to the start values

  2. The slope of the lines must be zero or positive

  3. No point of intersection shall be in the range of a line

Stores the drawn lines in guilineplt.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.save_line_button = Button(id='1052', ...)¶

Button widget to save audience lines. Triggers save_line

main.save_prev_line_button = Button(id='1054', ...)¶

Button widget to save a audience line before the selected line. Triggers create_prev_line

main.scale_p_axis(call=True)[source]¶

Changes the sizing mode of the venue slice. Calls therefore get_p_axis_rng. Triggered by p_equal_axis.

Parameters

call (bool, optional) – If True, calls steps to update the page. The default is True.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.set_ranges(**fig_rng_sz)[source]¶

Sets the x- and y-ranges of figures and plots.

Parameters

**fig_rng_sz (lists) – Must contain three argument called figs = [figure], sizes = [bool], ranges = [x_range, y_range].

Returns

Return type

None.

main.start_calc(arg)[source]¶

Main routine of the application. Runs the PALC algorithm with given setting venue slice by the user. Always calls get_initial_weights, calcPALC() or optimize_PALC, respectively, get_plot_array, venue_slice2CDS, calc_diff_tilt_angles, LSA_visualization, calcSFP, calcSPLoverX, calcHomogeneity, calcHistogram. Triggered by gui_start and for initialization by weighting_select and use_fixed_angle. Saves all output in belonging bokeh.models.ColumnDataSource to visualize the output and sets the ranges of the figures.

Parameters

arg (bool) – If false, return nothing.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.start_point_x = TextInput(id='1047', ...)¶

TextInput widget of start point of audience lines in x-direction. Triggers update_point.

main.start_point_y = TextInput(id='1048', ...)¶

TextInput widget of start point of audience lines in y-direction. Triggers update_point.

main.steps()[source]¶

Function to place the widgets on the pages. Can also be called to update the a page after a user input, e.g., to make sure that range of a plot is surely updated. Clears the page with bokeh.io.curdoc().clear().The arrangement of the widgets is done with bokeh.layouts.row, bokeh.layouts.column and bokeh.layouts.gridplot. The layout is then added to the root by bokeh.io.curdoc().add_root(). Note: Tab bars could also be used, but would need to have all widgets available in curdoc() the whole time.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.store_weighting_nu(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Stores actual value to calculate weighting factors (nu). Triggered by gui_weighting_nu.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value).

  • old (float) – Old nu.

  • new (float) – New nu.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.tap_handle(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Handles the tap tool that can be used in the sound field prediction on page four. Highlites the tapped line or venue point in pSFPv and pSFP.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (index).

  • old (int) – Old tapped index.

  • new (TYPE) – New tapped index.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.update_draw(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Updates Opt_w, Opt_SPLoverX_dict and SPLoverX_optreg, when optimal_SPLoverX function was triggered. This happens if the target slope weighting is chosen and the user changes the target slope. Triggered by data change of Opt_SPLoverX_dict.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (data).

  • old (float) – Float point of old data point.

  • new (float) – Float point of new data point (drawn by user in figure pSPLoverX.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.update_point(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Function that saves the input data to draw audience lines. Reads the input of the start and end points and stores them in guipal. After storing, updates the range of the Venue Slice Plot. Triggered by start_point_x, start_point_y, end_point_x and end_point_y.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Value attribute returned from widget.

  • old (float) – Old value of changed attribute.

  • new (float) – New value of changed attribute.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.update_weighting_step_size(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Updates weighting step size to update gui_weighting_nu by clicking on weighting_plus or weighting_minus. Triggered by weighting_step_size.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value).

  • old (str) – Old step size.

  • new (str) – New step size.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.upload_directivity(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Reads the directivity and stores the directivity of the plotted frequencies in directivity_dict_plt. Uploaded csv-data must be formatted as: frequency bins in lines and angle in degree in rows. Imaginary unit can be “j” or “i”. Triggered if button_input receives a .csv-file.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute.

  • old (str) – Old input.

  • new (str) – New input. csv-data to read.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.use_fixed_angle(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Enables or disables the the possibility to use a fixed angle for the heighest LSA cabinet. Runs an init of PALC to calculate the possible range of the angle of the fixed loudspeaker. Calls start_calc and get_fixed_angle_borders.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value).

  • old (str) – Old value if fixed angle is used.

  • new (str) – New value if fixed angle is used.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.weighting_minus = Button(id='1081', ...)¶

Button widget that decreases the weightings strength by the value of weighting_step_size.

main.weighting_plus = Button(id='1080', ...)¶

Button widget that increases the weightings strength by the value of weighting_step_size.

main.weighting_select(attr, old, new)[source]¶

Arranges the GUI depending on chosen weighting approach. Runs init PALC calculation by triggering start_calc, if ‘Target Slope’ is chosen. Triggered by gui_weighting.

Parameters

  • attr (str) – Changed attribute (value).

  • old (str) – Old weighting approach.

  • new (str) – New weighting approach.

Returns

Return type

None.

main.weighting_step_size = Select(id='1082', ...)¶

Select widget to set the step size of weighting_plus and weighting_minus. Triggers update_weighting_step_size.
